block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
FILM
Pleasantville ''India Now,'' feature and short films from India; presented by the Museum of Modern Art. Tuesday through May 9. $6 to $15. Jacob Burns Film Center, 364 Manville Road. (914) 773-7663.

Suffern International Film Festival, presented by Finkelstein Memorial Library: ''Riding Alone for Thousands of Miles,'' directed by Zhang Yimou; in Mandarin and Japanese with English subtitles. Tuesday at 7 p.m. $1 and $3. Cultural Arts Center, 145 College Road. (845) 732-8186.
FOR CHILDREN
Larchmont ''The Complete Works of Shakespeare (Abridged),'' comedy presented by M and M productions. April 29 at 4 p.m. Free. Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue. (914) 834-2281.
Nyack ''Blues Clues Live,'' family musical. May 5 at 10 a.m. and noon. $15. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.
Peekskill ''Peter and the Wolf,'' by the Hudson Vagabond Puppets. Friday at 7 p.m. $10 to $20. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.
Purchase Dan Zanes, family music concert. May 6 at noon and 3 p.m. Both sold out. Performing Arts Center, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6200.
Somers ''Feathers Sometimes Soar on the Breath of God,'' play about Emily Dickinson; presented by M and M productions. April 29 at 2 p.m. Somers Library, Reis Park. (914) 232-1285.
Yonkers ''Music and Merriment,'' children's program. Ages 2 to 5. Through June 20. Yonkers Crestwood Library, 16 Thompson Street. (914) 337-1500, Extension 360.

Yonkers ''Mother Goose Time,'' nursery rhymes, stories songs and finger plays. Ages 2 to 4. Through May 17. Free; registration required. Yonkers Public Library, Grinton I. Will branch, 1500 Central Park Avenue. (914) 337-1500.
MUSIC AND DANCE
Dobbs Ferry Amy Kanarek, cantor; folk, rock and jazz. May 6 at 7 p.m. $5 and $18. Greenburgh Hebrew Center, 515 Broadway. (914) 693-5121.
Irvington Greg Brown, singer-songwriter. May 5 at 8 p.m. $35. Irvington Town Hall, 85 Main Street. (914) 591-6602.
New Rochelle Westchester Chamber Orchestra, with Alex Abayev, violinist. May 5 at 8 p.m. $15 to $35. Joyce Auditorium, Iona College. (914) 637-7796.
Nyack Haale, rock and world music. May 5 at 8 p.m. $15 and $20. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.
Peekskill Al Martino, singer. May 6 at 3 p.m. $30 to $35. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.
Pleasantville Westchester Concert Singers; works by Duruflé, Schubert, Fauré and others. May 5 at 8 p.m. $15 and $20. Presbyterian Church, 400 Bedford Road. (914) 769-1782.
Poughkeepsie ''HVP Symphony Concert V: Metamorphosis,'' by the Hudson Valley Philharmonic. May 5 at 8 p.m. $24 to $44. Bardavon 1869 Opera House, 35 Market Street. (845) 473-2072.

Purchase Spring dance concert, presented by the Purchase College Conservatory of Dance. Through April 29. $13.50 to $20. The Pulse Performing Arts. Friday through May 6. $17.50. Olga Kern, pianist. Friday at 8 p.m. $17.50 to $65. Orpheus Chamber Orchestra. May 6 at 3 p.m. $17.50 to $65. Performing Arts Center, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6200.
Scarsdale Chris Groenendaal, Broadway performer. May 5 at 8 p.m. $32. J. C. C. of Mid-Westchester, 999 Wilmot Road. (914) 472-3300.
SPOKEN WORD
Sleepy Hollow Reading by Arthur Phillips and Thrity Umrigar, novelists. April 29 at 4:30 p.m. $3 and $5. Hudson Valley Writers' Center, 300 Riverside Drive. (914) 332-5953.
Yonkers Annual poetry festival, with readings, receptions, book signings and open mikes. Through April 29. Free. Heimbold Visual Arts Center, Sarah Lawrence College.
THEATER
Briarcliff Manor ''The Retreat From Moscow,'' drama by William Nicholson, presented by Hudson Stage Company. Through May 12. $15 to $25. Woodward Hall Theater, 235 Elm Road. (914) 271-2811.
Croton Falls ''Crimes of the Heart,'' comedy by Beth Henley. Through May 6. $25 to $29. Schoolhouse Theater, 3 Owens Road. (914) 277-8477.
Hudson Shakespeare's ''Hamlet,'' presented by the Det Lille Turneteater of Denmark. Friday at noon and 8 p.m. $10 and $15. Hudson Opera House, 327 Warren Street. (518) 822-1438.
Larchmont ''You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown,'' presented by the Harrison Players. Through April 29. $10 to $16. School of Saints John and Paul, 280 Weaver Street. (914) 937-8427.

Peekskill ''The Pirates of Penzance,'' operetta by Gilbert and Sullivan; benefit for the Franciscan Sisters of the Atonement at Graymoor in Garrison. April 29 at 2 p.m. $21.50. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.

Purchase ''Our Town,'' drama by Thornton Wilder, presented by the Purchase College Conservatory of Theater. Through May 5. $15 to $20. ''Hotel Cassiopeia,'' drama by Charles L. Mee, presented by the Siti Company. Friday at 8 p.m. $20 to $40. Performing Arts Center, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6200.

Yorktown Heights ''Seussical,'' musical by Stephen Flaherty and Lynn Ahrens, adapted from the books by Dr. Seuss; presented by Yorktown Stage. Through April 29. $19 to $25. Yorktown Community and Cultural Center, 1974 Commerce Street. (914) 962-5758.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Annandale-on-Hudson ''In Someone Else's Skin,'' ''Facts on the Ground'' and ''Stutter and Twitch,'' mixed-media group exhibitions. Through April 29. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Bard College, Center for Curatorial Studies. (845) 758-7598.

Armonk ''Frank Lloyd Wright and Usonia: An Experiment in Living.'' May 5 through June 24. Reception: May 5, 1 to 3 p.m. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. The Studio: An Alternative Space for Contemporary Art, 2 Maryland Avenue. (914) 273-1452.

Beacon ''Bau 28: Mud/Bone Studio 889: Encounters with Pablo Neruda,'' mixed-media group show. Through May 6. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Beacon Artists Union (bau), 161 Main Street. (845) 440-7584.

Beacon ''Fly Away Little Bird,'' multimedia exhibition by Monica D. Church. May 5 through 27. Reception: May 5, 6 to 9 p.m. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Go North: A Space for Contemporary Art, 469 Main Street.
Briarcliff Manor Watercolors by Edward Malsberg. Through May 12. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Images Art Gallery, 1157 Pleasantville Road. (914) 762-3000.
Bronx ''Sugar Buzz,'' mixed-media group show. Through May 15. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Lehman College Art Gallery, Bedford Park Boulevard West. (718) 960-8731.
Bronx ''Caribbean Gardens: Journey to Paradise,'' plant exhibition and related events. Through Sept. 16. $5 to $20. New York Botanical Garden, Bronx River Parkway and Fordham Road. (718) 817-8616.

Bronx ''Emily Dickinson Rendered,'' mixed-media group show of art inspired by the poetry of Emily Dickinson. Through May 25. $2 to $4; members and under 6, free; free for everyone on Tuesdays; free for everyone Saturdays, 9 a.m. to noon. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Wave Hill, 675 West 252nd Street. (718) 549-3200.

Bronxville ''A Celebration of Childhood,'' watercolors by Miriam Schulman. Through April 29. Reception: April 29, 1 to 3 p.m. Hours: Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Tuesdays, 9:30 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Thursdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Bronxville Public Library, 201 Pondfield Road. (914) 337-7680.
Croton Falls ''People Who Love People,'' group show. Through May 6. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. The Schoolhouse Gallery, 3 Owens Road. (914) 277-3461.
Dobbs Ferry ''From Spain to Avalon,'' mixed media exhibition. Through May 22. Hours: Sundays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. St. Cabrini Nursing Home, 115 Broadway. (914) 693-6800, Extension 522.
Dobbs Ferry Sculptures by Sondra Gold. Thursday through May 27. Reception: May 6, 2 to 5 p.m. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, 12:30 to 5:30 p.m. Upstream Gallery, 26 Main Street. (914) 674-8548.

Katonah ''Young Artists 2007,'' exhibition by high school students. Through May 6. Admission: $5, $3 for seniors and students. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

Kingston ''Set the Stage,'' exhibition of set, costume and poster designs. May 5 through 26. Reception: May 5, 5 to 8 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 1 to 6 p.m. Arts Society of Kingston Arts Center, 97 Broadway. (845) 338-0331.

Mount Vernon ''Overlooked Hero: John Glover and the American Revolution,'' historical documents and prints; continuing. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.

New Rochelle ''Byron Goto: A Retrospective,'' mixed-media exhibit. Through June 17. Hours: Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Thursdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Castle Gallery, 29 Castle Place. (914) 654-5423.

North Salem ''Brush with Nature,'' group exhibition featuring traditional and modern brush-painting techniques. Through June 5. Hammond Museum and Japanese Stroll Garden, 28 Deveau Road. (914) 669-5033.
Peekskill ''The Art of Persuasion,'' prints from the New York Society of Etchers. Through June 29. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.

Poughkeepsie Photography by Claudia Gorman. Tuesday through June 10. Guided daily house tours. Tuesday through Nov. 30. $6 and $9. Locust Grove, 2683 South Road (Route 9). (845) 454-4500, Extension 17.

Purchase ''On the Cusp,'' an installation by Laurel Garcia Colvin. Through May 12. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. and by appointment. Brownson Gallery, 2900 Purchase Street. (914) 323-5331.

Purchase ''Fugitive Artist: The Early Work of Richard Prince, 1974-77.'' Through June 24. ''Lesley Dill: Tremendous World,'' installations. ''New Media: When,'' group show. Through May 20. $3 to $5; members and children 12 and under, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Neuberger Museum of Art, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6100.

Rye ''Spotlight on Historical Costumes,'' a collection of seasonal costumes. Through June 7. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Square House Museum, 1 Purchase Street. (914) 967-7588.
Tarrytown ''Year Around,'' paintings by Tjasa Owen. Through May 16. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, to 5 p.m. Gallery du Soleil, 39 Main Street. (914) 332-4554.

Tivoli ''The Body Eclectic,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 29. ''Energy of Nature,'' paintings by Lara Chkhetiani. Friday through May 27. Reception: May 5, 6 to 8 p.m. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Tivoli Artists Co-op, 60 Broadway. (845) 757-2667.

Beacon ''Bau 28: Mud/Bone Studio 889: Encounters with Pablo Neruda,'' mixed-media group show. Through May 6. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Beacon Artists Union (bau), 161 Main Street. (845) 440-7584.

Beacon ''Fly Away Little Bird,'' multimedia exhibition by Monica D. Church. May 5 through 27. Reception: May 5, 6 to 9 p.m. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Go North: A Space for Contemporary Art, 469 Main Street.
Briarcliff Manor Watercolors by Edward Malsberg. Through May 12. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Images Art Gallery, 1157 Pleasantville Road. (914) 762-3000.

Bronx ''Emily Dickinson Rendered,'' mixed-media group show of art inspired by the poetry of Emily Dickinson. Through May 25. $2 to $4; members and under 6, free; free for everyone on Tuesdays; free for everyone Saturdays, 9 a.m. to noon. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Wave Hill, 675 West 252nd Street. (718) 549-3200.

Bronxville ''A Celebration of Childhood,'' watercolors by Miriam Schulman. Through April 29. Reception: April 29, 1 to 3 p.m. Hours: Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Tuesdays, 9:30 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Thursdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Bronxville Public Library, 201 Pondfield Road. (914) 337-7680.
Croton Falls ''People Who Love People,'' group show. Through May 6. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. The Schoolhouse Gallery, 3 Owens Road. (914) 277-3461.
Dobbs Ferry ''From Spain to Avalon,'' mixed media exhibition. Through May 22. Hours: Sundays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. St. Cabrini Nursing Home, 115 Broadway. (914) 693-6800, Extension 522.
Dobbs Ferry Sculptures by Sondra Gold. Thursday through May 27. Reception: May 6, 2 to 5 p.m. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, 12:30 to 5:30 p.m. Upstream Gallery, 26 Main Street. (914) 674-8548.

Katonah ''Young Artists 2007,'' exhibition by high school students. Through May 6. Admission: $5, $3 for seniors and students. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

Kingston ''Set the Stage,'' exhibition of set, costume and poster designs. May 5 through 26. Reception: May 5, 5 to 8 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 1 to 6 p.m. Arts Society of Kingston Arts Center, 97 Broadway. (845) 338-0331.

Mount Vernon ''Overlooked Hero: John Glover and the American Revolution,'' historical documents and prints; continuing. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.

New Rochelle ''Byron Goto: A Retrospective,'' mixed-media exhibit. Through June 17. Hours: Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Thursdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Castle Gallery, 29 Castle Place. (914) 654-5423.

North Salem ''Brush with Nature,'' group exhibition featuring traditional and modern brush-painting techniques. Through June 5. Hammond Museum and Japanese Stroll Garden, 28 Deveau Road. (914) 669-5033.
Peekskill ''The Art of Persuasion,'' prints from the New York Society of Etchers. Through June 29. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.

Poughkeepsie Photography by Claudia Gorman. Tuesday through June 10. Guided daily house tours. Tuesday through Nov. 30. $6 and $9. Locust Grove, 2683 South Road (Route 9). (845) 454-4500, Extension 17.

Purchase ''On the Cusp,'' an installation by Laurel Garcia Colvin. Through May 12. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. and by appointment. Brownson Gallery, 2900 Purchase Street. (914) 323-5331.

Through May 20. $3 to $5; members and children 12 and under, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Neuberger Museum of Art, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6100.

Tarrytown ''Year Around,'' paintings by Tjasa Owen. Through May 16. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, to 5 p.m. Gallery du Soleil, 39 Main Street. (914) 332-4554.

Tivoli ''The Body Eclectic,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 29. ''Energy of Nature,'' paintings by Lara Chkhetiani. Friday through May 27. Reception: May 5, 6 to 8 p.m. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Tivoli Artists Co-op, 60 Broadway. (845) 757-2667.
